title: "Llama poop sparked 57% more plant growth in a part of the Andes that was barren and ravaged by climate change"
excerpt: "Why llama poop? Llama poop, also called llama beans, contains nutrients like carbon and nitrogen that make soil hospitable to life. It also contains seeds from plants that the animals have grazed on."
